sub_title: Manager Communicatie Intern & Extern @ ABN AMRO Bank N.V. | Member @ SERTopVrouwen.nl
summary:
Currently I am working as Business Lead Mortgages Communication Internal and External at ABN AMRO Bank.

During my studies I was an outgoing student who actively took part in both academic- and social activities, which results in having a decent academic- and social development.  I am a Data Science enthusiast in and outside of work life. I enjoy to connect and interact with many different types of people. This is shown in my line of work in retail and promotion, my voluntary work, and my international experience in Canada. Besides studying and working, I combined several passions: skiing, traveling and the outdoor life. I consider myself as an fanatical reader and I like to go for a run occasionally. 

I studied Communication and Multimedia Design at the Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen. In order to further develop I started to study Computer Science and finally Business Information Systems at Eindhoven University of Technology, from which I graduated on January 18th, 2016.

After studying I started at ABN AMRO as IT-developer. I worked as a Business Process Improver with a Workflow Management tool and using lots of data to improve the processes. Since April 2023 I'm working as manager for the Communication Internal & External department for specifically mortgages within ABN AMRO.

school.name: TIAS School for Business and Society

awards.title: Participant in Best Graduates 2015
awards.description:
BestGraduates is the exclusive recruitment game for master students, studying at Dutch universities.
After sending your CV, participating companies will be able to invite you to an interview at the Nationale Carrièrebeurs. After these interviews these same companies will be able to invite you to their Inhouseday.
NS, Nuon, FrieslandCampina, ASML and Philips invited me to their Inhousday, which was a great honor. This really showed me what it would be like to work at one of these companies. Furthermore, I enjoyed the organized activities at these days.

test_scores.name: Process Mining: Data science in Action

profile_positions.description:
Using data analytics to improve our 250+ processes  for customer journeys. 
Working in a Tibco tool specified to ABN AMRO workflow specifics, named SmartFlow.  
Creating processes for employees to work on the necessary steps for their customer cases. 
Finding creative solutions for specific process steps like; Letters, Emails, CRM-messages, Notifying colleagues and the creation of XML's. 
Exploring the desires to improve the processes in quality, time spent and customer experience.
Reinvented the training documents about SmartFlow for colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Process Improvement Specialist

profile_positions.description:
I&T works council member since April 2018.
Chairwoman since September 2019, working with a group of 11 other council members.

Representing around 5000 employees. 
Chairing the weekly sessions with the other members and every month a session with the CI\&TO to discuss the latest topics and strategies. 
In meetings with senior management we discuss possible reorganisations, how to prevent them, and what impact these might have on the employees. 
Represented ABN AMRO's Medezeggenschap at the Sociaal Economische Raad in an event for younger OR-members.

Council work gives me an interesting dimension to the regular work day. For gaining a broader perspective that goes beyond that of my own department and will strengthen and expand the network as well as hone competencies, knowledge and skills. As a council member I represent colleagues in meetings held with management to discuss recent developments within the bank. Sharing my input with management and giving feedback helps shape the direction of the bank. I'm finding myself between the interests of ABN AMRO staff and the wider interests of the bank.
Being a member of this employee participation council gives me benefits too, in that I'll get to know the bank from a completely different angle and build up an extensive network at all levels. I'm also strengthen my skills and capabilities, whether it’s through negotiating, project-based working, analysing, presenting or chairing meetings: when you represent your co-workers, you’re likely to learn other things than you do in your day-to-day job.
profile_positions.title: Chairwoman of the I&T Works Council

profile_positions.title: Workshop Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
Tooling the BASE/X framework

Many business domains are transitioning towards a Service-Dominant Business setting where services are the basic mechanism for interacting with customers.  
BASE/X (Business Agility through Cross Organizational Service Engineering) framework is developed in the Eindhoven University of Technology, the Netherlands, with the objective to offer help for the business developers to transition towards a more Service-Dominant business setting. The design of business models is an essential component of the BASE/X framework, which uses the `Business Model Radar' to graphically depict the model.

There was a need for a tool to provide support and guidance for the users of the BASE/X framework. The study aimed to contribute to the fulfillment of this need in two ways. First, it offered a detailed requirement specification of the tool. Second, it provided a working prototype that satisfied majority of the requirements specified for the tool. The study also involved the evaluation of the working prototype. The evaluation was executed by comparing the output of an industry project to demonstrate the capability of the tool in handling real life cases, and to show the extended capabilities of the tool. In addition, the tool was evaluated by two users of the BASE/X framework for its usefulness, ease of use, and attitude towards using.
